verses.roman:
tam ūcuḥ pāṭyamānās te
sarve prāñjalayo nṛpa
kiṁ na indra jighāṁsasi
bhrātaro marutas tava

synonyms: tam—to him; ūcuḥ—said; pāṭyamānāḥ—being aggrieved; te—they; sarve—all; prāñjalayaḥ—with folded hands; nṛpa—O King; kim—why; naḥ—us; indra—O Indra; jighāṁsasi—do you want to kill; bhrātaraḥ—brothers; marutaḥ—Maruts; tava—your.
translation: O King, being very much aggrieved, they pleaded to Indra with folded hands, saying, "Dear Indra, we are the Maruts, your brothers. Why are you trying to kill us?"
